history.content:
For fall/spring at least, 70 usually has discussions at various times throughout the week, so you can both choose one right Tu/Thu or MW or Tu/Fri or whatever.

--------------------------------------

All of the Tuesday/Thursday sections for 70 occur after the lecture, so they're valid times for the discussions to occur.  It is certainly odd that almost all the sections are on Tuesdays and Thursdays (the original student answer is correct that this normally doesn't happen), but there's nothing to say that that isn't allowed to happen.  I don't think it has anything to do with the 999 section policy--I think it's just a quirk of how section times got assigned to the various classes.
For fall/spring at least, 70 usually has discussions at various times throughout the week, so you can both choose one right Tu/Thu or MW or Tu/Fri or whatever.

I've usually seen classes with MW discussions if they have TuTh lectures, or vice versa. Is it possible for a class to have TuTh discussions and lectures? Just wondering because CS 70 shows only TuTh discussions on the course catalog, and I was wondering if that would change due to the 999 section policy
history.subject: Possible to have discussion on TuTh for class with TuTh lecture?
